verses.verse: Now Nahash <S%H5176><s%> the Ammonite <S%H5984><s%> came <S%H5927><s%> up and besieged <S%H2583><s%> <S%H5921><s%> Jabesh-gilead <S%H3003><s%>; and all <S%H3605><s%> the men <S%H376><s%> of Jabesh said <S%H559><s%> to Nahash, <S%H5176><s%> "Make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with us and we will serve <S%H5647><s%> you."

But Nahash <S%H5176><s%> the Ammonite <S%H5984><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, "I will make <S%H3772><s%> [it] with you on this <S%H2088><s%> condition, that I will gouge <S%H5365><s%> out the right <S%H3225><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> of every <S%H3605><s%> one <S%H3605><s%> of you, thus I will make <S%H7760><s%> it a reproach <S%H2781><s%> on all <S%H3605><s%> Israel. <S%H3478><s%>"

And the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Jabesh <S%H3003><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, "Let <S%H7503><s%> us alone <S%H7503><s%> for seven <S%H7651><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> that we may send <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> throughout <S%H3605><s%> the territory <S%H1366><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%> Then, if <S%H518><s%> there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> to deliver <S%H3467><s%> us, we will come <S%H3318><s%> out to you."

Then the messengers <S%H4397><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Gibeah <S%H1390><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%> and spoke <S%H1696><s%> these words <S%H1697><s%> in the hearing <S%H241><s%> of the people, <S%H5971><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> lifted <S%H5375><s%> up their voices <S%H6963><s%> and wept. <S%H1058><s%>

Now behold, <S%H2009><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%> was coming <S%H935><s%> from the field <S%H7704><s%> behind <S%H310><s%> the oxen; <S%H1241><s%> and he said, <S%H559><s%> "What <S%H4100><s%> is [the matter] with the people <S%H5971><s%> that they weep <S%H1058><s%>?" So they related <S%H5608><s%> to him the words <S%H1697><s%> of the men <S%H376><s%> of Jabesh. <S%H3003><s%>

Then the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> came <S%H9484><s%> upon Saul <S%H7586><s%> mightily <S%H9484><s%> when he heard <S%H8085><s%> these <S%H428><s%> words, <S%H1697><s%> and he became <S%H2734><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> angry. <S%H639><s%> <S%H2734><s%>

And he took <S%H3947><s%> a yoke <S%H6776><s%> of oxen <S%H1241><s%> and cut <S%H5408><s%> them in pieces, <S%H5408><s%> and sent <S%H7971><s%> [them] throughout <S%H3605><s%> the territory <S%H1366><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of messengers, <S%H4397><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Whoever <S%H834><s%> does not come <S%H3318><s%> out after <S%H310><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%> and after <S%H310><s%> Samuel, <S%H8050><s%> so <S%H3541><s%> shall it be done <S%H6213><s%> to his oxen. <S%H1241><s%>" Then the dread <S%H6343><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> on the people, <S%H5971><s%> and they came <S%H3318><s%> out as one <S%H259><s%> man. <S%H376><s%>
And he numbered <S%H6485><s%> them in Bezek; <S%H966><s%> and the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> were 300000, and the men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> 30000.

And they said <S%H559><s%> to the messengers <S%H4397><s%> who had come, <S%H935><s%> "Thus <S%H3541><s%> you shall say <S%H559><s%> to the men <S%H376><s%> of Jabesh-gilead <S%H3003><s%>, 'Tomorrow, <S%H4279><s%> by the time the sun <S%H8121><s%> is hot, <S%H2552><s%> you shall have <S%H1961><s%> deliverance. <S%H8668><s%>'" So the messengers <S%H4397><s%> went <S%H935><s%> and told <S%H5046><s%> the men <S%H376><s%> of Jabesh; and they were glad. <S%H8055><s%>

Then the men <S%H376><s%> of Jabesh <S%H3003><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Tomorrow <S%H4279><s%> we will come <S%H3318><s%> out to you, and you may do <S%H6213><s%> to us whatever <S%H3605><s%> seems good <S%H2896><s%> to you."

And it happened <S%H1961><s%> the next <S%H4283><s%> morning <S%H4283><s%> that Saul <S%H7586><s%> put <S%H7760><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> in three <S%H7969><s%> companies; <S%H7218><s%> and they came <S%H935><s%> into the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the camp <S%H4264><s%> at the morning <S%H1242><s%> watch, <S%H821><s%> and struck <S%H5221><s%> down <S%H5221><s%> the Ammonites <S%H5983><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> the heat <S%H2527><s%> of the day. <S%H3117><s%> And it came <S%H1961><s%> about that those who survived <S%H7604><s%> were scattered, <S%H6327><s%> so that no <S%H3808><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> of them were left <S%H7604><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>

Then the people <S%H5971><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Samuel, <S%H8050><s%> "Who <S%H4310><s%> is he that said, <S%H559><s%> 'Shall Saul <S%H7586><s%> reign <S%H4427><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> us?' Bring <S%H5414><s%> the men, <S%H376><s%> that we may put <S%H4191><s%> them to death. <S%H4191><s%>"

But Saul <S%H7586><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Not a man <S%H376><s%> shall be put <S%H4191><s%> to death <S%H4191><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> for today <S%H3117><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has accomplished <S%H6213><s%> deliverance <S%H8668><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%>"

Then Samuel <S%H8050><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the people, <S%H5971><s%> "Come <S%H1980><s%> and let us go <S%H1980><s%> to Gilgal <S%H1537><s%> and renew <S%H2318><s%> the kingdom <S%H4410><s%> there. <S%H8033><s%>"

So all <S%H3605><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> to Gilgal, <S%H1537><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> they made <S%H4427><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%> king <S%H4427><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> in Gilgal. <S%H1537><s%> There <S%H8033><s%> they also offered <S%H2076><s%> sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> of peace <S%H8002><s%> offerings <S%H8002><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord; <S%H3068><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the men <S%H376><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> rejoiced <S%H8055><s%> greatly. <S%H3966><s%>
